data.title: When will Brad Pitt’s movie about Formula 1 be released? Release window and date for first teaser
data.meta_description: Brad Pitt’s high-cost movie about Formula 1 will not be released in the immediate future, but fans will be able to watch its first teaser this weekend.
data.text:
Brad Pitt’s highly expensive movie about Formula 1 already has a launch window to officially debut in movie theaters. The film starring the actor will be called “F1″ and will be released sometime in the summer of 2025.

Although there is still a year left before moviegoers can see it, Formula 1 has confirmed that on Sunday, July 7, we will see the first teaser as part of the Silverstone Grand Prix.

READ ALSO: Actor Danny Trejo embroiled in Fourth of July fisticuffs

READ ALSO: LEGO Star Wars reveals more on Skeleton Crew

What do we know about ‘F1′, the official movie of the race which stars Brad Pitt?

That Silverstone is the GP chosen to tease the film for the first time is no coincidence. In 2023 it was the setting chosen to shoot video of the actor racing in the car. British world champion Lewis Hamilton is one of the co-producers of the Apple film.

It’s directed by cinematography veteran Joseph Kosinski. The director has had successes in his career such as ‘Top Gun: Maverick’ (2022), ‘Tron Legacy’ (2010) and ‘Oblivion’ (2013).

READ ALSO: Why is Brad Pitt’s F1 movie so expensive?

What is Brad Pitt’s newest movie about?

The sports drama focuses on the life of a fictional retired Formula 1 driver named Sonny Hayes. After leaving the series after going through a crash, he goes back to become a mentor and partner up with a talented young driver named Joshua Pierce played by Damson Idris on the Apex Grand Prix (APXGP) team.

Pitt will be accompanied by other acting heavyweights such as Javier Bardem, Callie Cooke, Tobias Menzies, Kerry Condon, Sarah Niles, Eddie Eniel, Will Merrick and Samson Kayo, among others.
